meanings.definition: A marine animal with a cylindrical body and tentacles surrounding a central mouth.
meanings.sent1: The polypeds in the ocean have long tentacles to catch their food.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of polypeds to understand marine ecosystems better.
meanings.sent3: The polypeds had a party in their underwater home, waving their tentacles in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The polypeds danced gracefully in the water, their tentacles moving like ribbons in the wind.
meanings.sent5: Children were amazed by the colorful polypeds at the aquarium, their tentacles swaying gently.

meanings.definition: A colony of polyps, especially in coral.
meanings.sent1: The vibrant coral reef was teeming with colorful polypeds.
meanings.sent2: Divers marveled at the intricate structures created by coral polypeds.
meanings.sent3: The polypeds in the coral had a meeting to discuss their next expansion plans.
meanings.sent4: The coral polypeds worked together like a bustling city, each contributing to the community.
meanings.sent5: The tiny polypeds built their coral homes with precision, creating a beautiful underwater landscape.

meanings.definition: A type of invertebrate animal with a tubular body and tentacles.
meanings.sent1: The polypeds in the rock pool were fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: Children enjoyed learning about different types of polypeds during their marine biology class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous polypeds played hide-and-seek among the rocks, their tentacles peeking out.
meanings.sent4: The polypeds in the tide pool seemed to dance with the gentle sway of the water.
meanings.sent5: The curious explorer discovered a new species of polypeds with unusually long tentacles.
